title: Work One’s Fingers to the Bone
desc: Work One’s Fingers to the Bone: Work very hard over an extended period

title: Worn to a Frazzle
desc: Worn to a Frazzle: Exhausted, completely worn out

title: Wouldn’t Be Caught Dead
desc: Wouldn’t Be Caught Dead: Would absolutely not allow myself to do this

title: Writing (Handwriting) on the Wall
desc: Writing (Handwriting) on the Wall: Hints of coming disaster

title: Year In, Year Out
desc: Year In, Year Out: Annually without change

title: You Can Lead a Horse to Water, but You Can’t Make It Drink
desc: You Can Lead a Horse to Water, but You Can’t Make It Drink: It’s very hard to force someone to do something against his or her will.

title: You Can Say That Again!
desc: You Can Say That Again!: I agree totally!

title: You Can Take It to the Bank
desc: You Can Take It to the Bank: I absolutely guarantee this

title: You Can’t Judge a Book by Its Cover
desc: You Can’t Judge a Book by Its Cover: You can’t know people (or things) well by their external appearances.

title: You Can’t Make an Omelet (Omelette)
desc: You Can’t Make an Omelet (Omelette): Without Breaking

title: You Can’t Make Fish of One and Fowl of the Other
desc: You Can’t Make Fish of One and Fowl of the Other: People must be treated equally.

title: You Know the Drill
desc: You Know the Drill: You are already familiar with the procedure.

title: You Snooze, You Lose
desc: You Snooze, You Lose: If you delay or are not alert, you will miss opportunities

title: Young at Heart
desc: Young at Heart: Having a youthful outlook, regardless of age

title: Your Guess Is as Good as Mine
desc: Your Guess Is as Good as Mine: I don’t know; I have no idea

title: Your Mileage May Vary
desc: Your Mileage May Vary: You may get different results. This does not necessarily refer to a car, although it may.

title: Your Number Is Up
desc: Your Number Is Up: You are going to die (or suffer some bad misfortune or setback)

title: You’re Driving Me Nuts
desc: You’re Driving Me Nuts: To make someone giddy or crazy

title: Yours Truly
desc: Yours Truly: Me

title: Zero In On
desc: Zero In On: Focus closely on something; take aim at something

title: Zig When One Should Be Zagging
desc: Zig When One Should Be Zagging: To make an error; to choose an incorrect course

title: Zip One’s Lip
desc: Zip One’s Lip: Be quiet
